topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack® Carrier Grade (Beta): Adding or Removing Ports

section.p:
A port is a connection point for attaching a single device, such as the NIC of a virtual server, to a virtual network. You can configure rich network topologies by creating and configuring networks and subnets, and then instructing other OpenStack services like Compute to attach virtual devices to ports on these networks.
As an admin you can add ports to an existing subnet. Non-admin users can create subnets, but cannot create ports.
You can edit the device associated with a port and change the admin state, as needed.

li.xref: Change the device associated with the port
Change the admin state between Up or Down

li.p: Launch the HP Helion OpenStack(R) Horizon Dashboard.

ol.li: Click the Admin dashboard, then the System panel, then the Networks link. The network(s) for the selected project appear.
Click the name of the network you want to work with.
On the Network Detail page, click Create Port.

On the Create Port screen:
Enter a descriptive name for the port.
Leave the Admin State field selected to create a port in the active state. Or, clear the field to create a non-active port.
Optionally, specify a device ID to assign the port to that device.
Optionally, specify a device name to assign the port to that device.
Note: If you do not know the device ID and name, you can create the port and later edit the port to add the ID and name.

Click Create Port. A message appears indicating if the port was successfully created. When the port is created, an available fixed IP address out of one the designated subnets is associated with the port.

section.title: Edit a port
section.p:
Launch the HP Helion OpenStack(R) Horizon Dashboard.
Click the Admin dashboard, then the System panel, then the Networks link. The network(s) for the selected project appear.
Click the name of the network you want to work with.
On the Network Detail page, for the port you want to delete, click Edit Port.
On the Edit Port screen:
a. Leave the Admin State field selected to create a port in the active state. Or, clear the field to create a non-active port. b. Specify a device ID to assign the port to that device. c. Specify a device name to assign the port to that device.
Click Save Changes.
A message appears indicating if the port was successfully modified.

section.title: Delete a port
section.p:
Launch the HP Helion OpenStack(R) Horizon Dashboard.
Click the Admin dashboard, then the System panel, then the Networks link. The network(s) for the selected project appear.
Click the name of the network you want to work with.
On the Network Detail page, for the port you want to delete, click More > Delete Port.
In the confirmation screen, click Delete Port. A message appears indicating if the port was deleted successfully.
